text: I liked how the waiting area had refreshments.  I went here to get a key fob made for my car.  I waited from 2 pm until 7:30 pm.  They estimated it would take 2 hours to complete.  I called 3 times to check on the status of my vehicle .  When they finally called me back the guy on the phone told me that they succesfully programmed my key fob clicker.  He also said that the actuator on the driver side back door did not work.  But I asked if they were able to complete the programming and he assured me it was a yes.  I went to the dealership and I paid.  When I walked up to my car I tested it and it did not work.  So I went into the office at 7:45 as the staff was all leaving and told them it did not work.  Good thing I tested it before I left because I would have never known until I got home.  The service dept employee  told me that he would fix it in 4 days because I told him I would order the actuator for 25$ online and fix it somewhere else instead of buying it from them for 300$.  So basically I waited all day long for them to just sell me a key fob that didnt work.  I think the communication here is poor because they have so many employees there.  Hopefully on Tuesday we can get this all situated.

Barracuda Tacos is great! We have been enjoying their taco selection since they opened. I am a vegetarian but love Tacos. They have AWESOME salsa and a jar of the salsa matcha is a most for the home pantry.
-
Also, I've read some of the reviews and think there is some confusion regarding operations. The outdoor eat-in dining experience is very casual and laid back. The seating is first come first serve, seat yourself tables. Pre pandemic sometimes you'd have to share a community table with usually cool strangers because they were so busy in the summer. The utensils and napkins are self serve. Drinks from large parties are often self pick up at the drink window. There are not traditional servers who cater to individual guests and tables. They are more like helpful friendly food runners.

text:
It's always nice to visit a place that holds so many pleasant memories.
While browsing through the White Elephant and looking up and towards the back seeing that old 3 blade fan hanging from the ceiling wondering how many times I sat in front of it on a Friday or Saturday night feeling the cool breeze during those hot summer nights . I must have been in a dazed and confused moment remembering the old Thunderbird Skating Rink, I must have been doing the hokie pokie when I finally heard the owner repeatedly say, can I help you find something. Right then I seen it tucked away in the corner, I knew the answer before I asked but it didn't stop me from asking anyway ["How much you want for the disco ball "]right away he replied ["all of the original items from the Thunderbird days are not for sale."]
Those were the days.  After 5yrs of doing the hokie pokie I graduated to Coffee st @ Lakeshore Dr.  I would pass up eternal life to drift back in time to 1976-1980, I wouldn't mind reliving 1978 over and over and over again.  Anyway White Elephant lots of secondhand furniture, prices are reasonable.  Thunderbird skating rink, lots of memories no more skating.

text:
So torn.

On the one hand, the guy who came by afterwards and repaired some of the minor damage was great. On the other hand, the moving experience itself was horrible.

I had a 3 bed 1 bath house moving to a 3 bed 2 bath house. I had 2 bedroom sets, an office, a full living room, 15 boxes, 10 bags, and 3 appliances to move. The distance between locations was under 2 miles. We were quoted 4-5hrs.

The last moving company I hired did a move from baton rouge to Denham with the same contents in under 4hrs with travel time.

The two men that turned up dragged their feet every opportunity they could. They kept closing the truck wanting to move to the 2nd house when the 1st house still had contents to be moved. They kept taking on-the-clock breaks. They kept losing hardware for disassembled furniture.

I literally had to keep stating "everything but the fridge and oven needs to be on the truck" but they still failed to load up all of the soft materials, appliances, etc, on the first trip. They packed so stupidly they had to make 2 trips.

On the first trip, to the new location, they left the same time as me and somehow took an additional 15 minutes driving the 1 mile to the new house. They forgot the bed hardware at the old house. After unloading the truck, I had to send they put the furniture where I asked them to put it and not just drop it in the center of the room.

I then had to bribe them to make a 2nd trip to retrieve the 10 bags, 2 missed appliances, and a bunch of other small items. Again, I had to keep reminding them I'm paying for their time and I needed everything moved, everything. They kept closing the truck, again. They kept walking past items, stating rooms were empty when plastic crates and PCs were sitting in the middle of the floor. 6hrs after the move started, I finally managed to get nearly everything into the new house.

Of course, we went back and retrieved stuff like the dryer vent line, the microwave, two more boxes, and two baskets with electronics that were missed on both the first and second trip.

The manager who turned up 3 days after the move apologized for the men, and repaired some of the damages. He cut a check for $165 to offset damages to a coffee table that looked like the guys used as a dance floor.

Today, I finally had a reason to start looking at hanging my 55" 4k Samsung TV. To my horror, I just found not one, but 3 decent scratches on the glass. Here's hoping 2 men and a truck can cover those damages too.u

Edit: damage guy hasn't returned 5 calls and check for damages never arrived.
prediction_reason: This is a detailed, genuine review describing a specific moving experience with Two Men and a Truck. The reviewer provides extensive details about their moving service experience, including specific problems with the movers, timing issues, damaged items, and follow-up interactions with management. The 1-star rating is consistent with the numerous negative experiences described. Despite being critical, it clearly relates to the moving company's services and represents a legitimate customer experience.
name: Two Men and a Truck
category: ['Mover', 'Moving and storage service', 'Moving supply store', 'Piano moving service']

text:
Planet Fitness is a pretty straight-forward operation.  You pay a low monthly fee, and a reasonable annual fee, and you get access to some really great equipment, weights, and a clean environment 24/7.  Even during peak hours you can still get a treadmill or cardio equipment.  Everyone seems friendly enough, but I haven't demanded much out of the staff either.  They offer small classes which are available to sign up at the desk.  That's nice!  There are stations with napkins and disinfectant to use after you get done with your equipment, and the culture there is that everyone seems to use it.  I've never caught a cold from going!
I go 2x a week and run a couple miles on the treadmill and lift a few weights.  You can plug your headphones into the treadmill and listen to any of the 10+ channels they have on the overhead TV's.  I feel like I get every cent's worth of my membership, which is more than I can say for other $40+/mo gyms I've tried in town.  Thanks Planet Fitness for meeting my needs as a fitness facility!

text:
Left a 5 star review in June of last year when they removed a cyst from my dog, Diesel's eyelid. The surgery went well and they truly did an amazing job.

Flash forward to now, I just wanted to edit my review and give a MILLION thanks to Dr. Julie! She saved my cats life, truly! I brought him in to the ER because he was very lethargic. Little did I know, he was dying. He had an extreme case of FLUTD. They put in a catheter and IV and transferred him to Wexler the following morning. Upon bringing him they did an Ultrasound(Which the After Hours clinic did not) and she saw that his bladder in fact tore/ruptured. This was a situation where I was prepared he may not make it. HOWEVER, Dr. Julie, Dr. Wexler and their staff did everything they could and here we are a week later and he has made a total recovery! I can't thank Dr. Julie enough! She's  been so involved and tentative to Tux and I dont think he would have made it had he gone to a different vet. Thank y oi u thank you thank you!

text: Hadn't been in almost 2 years so thought I'd give it the benefit of the doubt tonight. Kind of knew better in the back of my mind but went with the all you can eat for $21.95 special per person. Since it's all you can eat special they bring you the nastiest smallest portions of food they can find for example the beef teriyaki we ordered 3 thinking it would be nice little single portions maybe 2 oz of steak each, in this case to feed one person they give you 3 cut up pieces! Yep you read that right yes 3 to 4 PIECES of steak (LESS THAN .2 OZ)  that is red ,raw has blood on plate and cannot be chewed as it is all fat. 🤮🤮 The sushi I ordered was not what I wanted apparently snow crab roll is gone and everything else they had sushi wise looked very old and not appetizing at all. here I am at 8:30 making dinner at home after sitting there for one whole hour trying to get the hell out -I will never ever ever be back!

text:
Update: 4 years and another lazy, half-hearted remodel later, I still keep wishing this chain would just fold and be replaced by any other theater chain. Still the same cruddy screens and terrible sound. Now with reclining seats in maybe half the theaters! Yay.

Original review:
This location underwent a lackluster, half-hearted remodel (the chairs are nice, the colors are not) that failed to replace aged, stained and otherwise damaged screens. The audio in most of the theaters substitutes volume for a quality and fidelity that is sorely lacking. Following the remodel, the size of the popcorn containers was reduced considerably while the price was most decidedly not, and the quality seems to have declined as well (this coming from a movie theater popcorn junkie). The Grand 16 makes me wish for another chain to come to town every time I attend. Their monopoly on Lafayette cinema had allowed them to get away with a steady decline in every measure of quality and, frankly, I see far more movies for the first time on Vudu or Blu-ray now as a result.
prediction_reason: The review provides a detailed and genuine experience about visiting this movie theater location. The reviewer discusses specific aspects like screens, sound quality, seating, popcorn, and facility remodels - all directly relevant to the movie theater business. Despite the negative sentiment and 2-star rating, this represents a legitimate customer experience and feedback about the theater's services and facilities.
